page.title: 15Tourism in Sudbury
page.content: Tourists come to the Sudbury area from all over the world to enjoy the scenery and places of historical interest. THE MILL HOTEL-Is a place of interest in its own right, it was mentioned in the first Domesday Book and until recently was a working mill. People stay in the hotel on business and pleasure trips, foreign tourists come mainly from France and USA. GAINSBOROUGH'S HOUSE-Attracts about 12,000 tourists per year.People come from as far afield as USA and Australia to see the birthplace of Thomas Gainsborough. SHOPPING-A survey of Sudbury's shopkeepers showed that schoolchildren from France,Germany and Spain were the most frequent foreign visitors. BY GARY BALDWIN, NEIL DATCHLER, STEPHEN NEWCOMB, MARK BARNES, CHRIS WILKINS.
